text: Euonymus angulatus is a species of tree in the family Celastraceae. They can grow up to tall and have dull purple flowers. They grow in medium elevation evergreen forests between . It is endemic to India, where it is known from Karnataka, Kerala, and Tamil Nadu. It is threatened by habitat loss.World Conservation Monitoring Centre. 1998. Euonymus angulatus. In: IUCN 2013. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2013.1.
